intro: Humboltia segoviensis, commonly known as the Segovia humboldtia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to a small region in Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Humboltia segoviensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
